item.title: Arduino IDE build process explained (in details)
item.author: embeddedk8
item.description: Many beginner embedded developers begin their journey with the Arduino development board, because it’s extremely easy to use even with no prior knowledge. After installing Arduino IDE and connecting the board, you can just choose an example Sketch and with two clicks compile it and upload it to the board. But if you want to be able to move to more professional boards or setups, it’s necessary to understand what is an Arduino Sketch and what is really happening under the hood when Arduino IDE is compiling your code.
